intro: Cyclobalanopsis vibrayana, commonly known as the Philippine ironwood, is a large evergreen tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks and beeches, and is characterized by its hard, durable wood. The tree can grow up to 30 meters tall, with a broad, spreading crown and thick, leathery leaves. Its seeds are enclosed in a woody capsule, and it plays an important ecological role in its native habitat. Due to its slow growth and high value, it is also considered a threatened species.
